meanings.definition: To decline to accept or comply with something.
meanings.sent1: She was refusing to eat her vegetables at dinner.
meanings.sent2: He kept refusing to help with the chores around the house.
meanings.sent3: The cat was refusing to play with the new toy, preferring the old one instead.
meanings.sent4: The student was refusing to follow the instructions, causing frustration for the teacher.
meanings.sent5: The stubborn child was refusing to wear a jacket despite the cold weather.

meanings.definition: To show unwillingness to do something.
meanings.sent1: The tired dog was refusing to go for a walk.
meanings.sent2: She was refusing to go to bed, wanting to stay up and play longer.
meanings.sent3: The picky eater was refusing to try the new food, sticking to familiar dishes.
meanings.sent4: The employee was refusing to attend the meeting, citing a prior commitment.
meanings.sent5: The little boy was refusing to share his toys with his sister, causing a small argument.

meanings.sent1: The company was refusing the return of the damaged product.
meanings.sent2: He was refusing the offer of a promotion, preferring to stay in his current role.
meanings.sent3: The magician was refusing to reveal the secret behind his tricks, keeping the mystery alive.
meanings.sent4: The detective was refusing to believe the suspect's alibi, suspecting foul play.
meanings.sent5: The artist was refusing to compromise on the vision for her painting, staying true to her style.
